climbs.name: HD's Chimney
climbs.fa: Dylan Pike and Elliot Brown, March 2018

content.description: Identify a right trending black crack that leads to a right facing chimney at approximately 100'. The start of the route is protected by a bolt. Clip the bolt, and follow the crack, passing a short, thin section (FA party used one point of A0 here) to a sloping ledge. Optional belay here on solid cams. From the ledge, climb a hand crack to a roof, traverse to the right, and swim up into the chimney, or climb the unprotected slab to the right. Top out the formation, and walk off to the east.
content.location: Located in the middle of the western formation.

climbs.name: The Easy Way Up
climbs.fa: Dylan Pike and Emily Harris, May 2018

content.description:
Identify a left facing flake/corner on the southeast face of the tidal wave. Climb the corner to a roof, then belay on the slab above the roof. Identify another left facing corner/large chimney. Climb this for approximately 20', then escape out right onto a ledge. Belay here to reduce rope drag. From here, climb 4th class terrain to the summit.

Descend via bolted rap anchors on the east face.
content.location: Southeast face of the tidal wave.
